visualization_prompt: Generate a dot plot showing monthly comparison of items bought versus sold using stacked columns with rectangular markers
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time series with 12 monthly observations each, comparing transactional inventory activity. Categorical x-axis labels represent months, while the y-axis shows discrete item counts. Synthetic data maintains domain consistency with integer values and demonstrates inverse relationship patterns - acquired items (μ=6.58, σ=1.62) consistently outweigh sold items (μ=1.92, σ=1.16) with complementary monthly fluctuations. The dot plot variant effectively visualizes discrete counts through Tufte-inspired data-ink optimization, using solid rectangles instead of traditional dots. Cairo's preattentive processing principles are applied through color encoding (red=outflow, green=inflow) and positional alignment. Stacked columns with single-slot layout maintain proportional relationships while avoiding occlusion, with y-axis integer enforcement supporting accurate magnitude perception.
